TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EditableDesignerRegion extends System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion

Docs.summary: Represents an editable content region within the design-time markup for the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the EditableDesignerRegion class to help manage templates at design time. A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> will use an instance of this class with its <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method to generate HTML markup of the region's content.
## Examples This example shows how to create a control with two clickable regions and an EditableDesignerRegion object with two views, or templates. Compile the project, then open the page in a visual designer and switch to design (WYSIWYG) view. There are two clickable views, **View1** and **View2**. Click **View1** and drag the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> control from the lower part of the page into the empty designer region just below the clickable regions. Click **View2** and drag the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control into the empty designer region. Click **View1** again, and the region with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox> reappears. Click **View2** and the region with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> reappears. Switch back to source view to see how your changes are persisted in the HTML markup
> [!NOTE] > Your project must have a reference to the System.Design.dll assembly.
[!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.e_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.e_1_1.cs)] [!code-cs[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.e_1_2.aspx)] [!code-vb[SimpleMultiRegionControlDesigner#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.e_1_2.aspx)]
